title: Taliban Abruptly Decide to Keep Secondary Schools Closed to Girls
sub_head: Night before the resumption of classes, the group canceled a long-planned reopening for those in seventh-grade and above in Afghanistan
body:
The Taliban have suddenly halted a plan to reopen secondary schools for girls, going back on an earlier pledge and dealing another blow to womenâ€™s rights under their rule.
Most schools for girls over sixth-grade have been shut since the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan in August. The group had previously said all teenage girls would be allowed to return to classes from March 23, the start of the new school year.
